intro: Conyza sennii, commonly known as the velvetleaf, is a flowering plant in the sunflower family (Asteraceae). It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa, Asia, and Australia, and has been introduced to other parts of the world. The plant is characterized by its hairy, heart-shaped leaves and small yellow flowers that appear in clusters. It is often found in disturbed areas such as roadsides and fields, and can become invasive in certain environments. Conyza sennii is also known for its ability to produce a large number of seeds, which contributes to its spread and persistence.
